page.title: 14CLUTTON -ROAD SAFETY
page.content: We have a problem with road safety in Clutton. We have to be careful when we come to and leave school and when we ride our bikes. The main road through the village is narrow and twisty. There is only enough room for one lane of traffic in each direction. If people park their cars then there is little room for cars to pass. The road is often used by large lorries from Bromilow's yard at the bottom of the road. Many cars also go too fast along the road. We interviewed Mrs. Kingman who is the crossing lady for Clutton School. She has been working there for four years. She told us that the children are good and donot run across the road. There have not been any accidents yet but some near misses. We have planted trees to stop the balls going over the school wall and possibly causing accidents.
